channel.title: Morning Mail
channel.description: Stay updated on the latest news and events happening in the RPI community.

item.title: Graduate Student Appreciation Day Dinner | Oct. 14
item.description: Tuesday, October 14, 2025 5:00 PM - 8:00 PM - The Office of Graduate Education & Graduate Experience invites all graduate students to a special appreciation dinner. Please join us for an evening of delectable cuisine and engaging conversation as we acknowledge your commitment and efforts. Take this opportunity to unwind and mingle with your fellow students. This event offers a platform to connect with Deans and staff in a laid-back setting and cultivate a stronger graduate student community…
item.author: Students

item.title: Fall 2025 School of Engineering Midterm Student Course Evaluations Now Open
item.description: Date: Friday, October 10, 2025 (all day) - Fall 2025 School of Engineering (SoE) Midterm course evaluations are now open. Your feedback is very important to the Institute and the school, so please complete the SoE midterm evaluation surveys for all your courses! Evaluations will be available through Thursday, October 23, 2025.
item.author: Students

item.title: Planning to Graduate in December 2025?
item.description: Planning to Graduate in December 2025? Have you completed your degree application in SIS yet? If not, SIS is open to apply; the deadline is Friday October 10. Make sure you also refer to https://rpi-registrar.zendesk.com/hc/en-us/categories/27235439677588-Graduation-Commencement

item.title: Need help finding sources for your paper or project?
item.description: Librarians are available for virtual consultations Monday–Friday! Get expert help with finding articles, data, and credible background info.

item.title: GRADUATE STUDENT APPRECIATION DAY | Oct. 14
item.description: Date: Tuesday, October 14, 2025 (all day) - The Office of Graduate Education & Graduate Experience sincerely appreciates your contributions! We value your dedication and hard work in our graduate community. Please take a moment to contact your department to learn about their event that day. Your commitment and involvement are truly valued and make a significant difference in enhancing the graduate experience. Thank you for being an integral part of our vibrant academic community!

item.title: Lighting Research Center Students Honored with Top Industry Awards
item.description: Two 2025 graduates of the Master of Science in Lighting program at RPI’s Lighting Research Center (LRC) were recently honored with top industry awards recognizing exceptional student design work.

item.title: Chemistry Fall 2025 Seminar Series | Oct. 14
item.description: Date: Tuesday, October 14, 2025 4:00 PM - 5:00 PM - Sebastian Vega, Associate Professor of Biomedical Engineering at Rowan University, will talk about “Hydrogels and Synthetic Receptors for Engineering Cell-Material Communication”.

item.title: Save The Date! Faculty and Staff Benefits Expo - November 7, 2025
item.description: Empower your wellbeing and make the most of your benefits. Join us on Friday, November 7th at the East Campus Athletic Village (ECAV) from 10:30am - 2pm for the 2025 Faculty and Staff Benefits Expo—your one-stop shop for insights, resources, support and LUNCH!
item.author: Faculty and Staff

item.title: Join us for the next talk in the Quantum Vision Lecture Series | Oct. 13
item.description: Mon., Oct. 13, 2025 4:00 PM - 5:00 PM Featuring Elias Towe, Ph.D., Grobstein Professor of Materials Science and Engineering & Professor of Electrical and Computer Engineering, Carnegie Mellon University. The talk will explore innovative strategies for advancing quantum research and discuss opportunities to leverage RPI’s intellectual and infrastructure strengths to enhance our position at the forefront of this rapidly evolving domain. 30 minute presentation, followed by a discussion.
item.author: Faculty and Staff

item.title: Faculty and Staff In-Person Workshop: Get Wise with the Owl
item.description:
Date: Wednesday, October 22, 2025 12:00 PM - 1:00 PM - Discover how to make the most of your Meeting Owl! Whether your department already has an Owl or you’re considering one, this hands-on workshop will walk you through everything you need to know — from setup and placement to an overview of benefits and key features like 360° video, automatic speaker tracking, and pairing devices. Please register using the Event URL in the See section of the calendar event.

For information about sharing your news or events, or to change your subscription settings, visit morningmail.rpi.edu.
